Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Processor
  • public class Processor
extends java.lang.Object
    Processor class - The class that processes the desigred image.

    This class manipulates Java BufferedImages, which are effectively 2d arrays of pixels. Each pixel is a single integer packed with 4 values inside it.

    This class contains many utility methods, each which manipulate the image in different ways. There are methods to colorify the image, add a filter to it, distort it, transform it, sharpen it, or even add hidden text to it! The documentation for each specific method can be found below. There are also two modular methods for dealing with bit shift operators. They are unpackPixel() and packagePixel(). The first extracts the RGB and alpha values of a certain color integer (color to pixel conversion), and the second does the opposite by "packing" the four integers back into a color integer.

    Version:
    December 2021
    Author:
    Jerry Zhu, Matthew Gong, Jordan Cohen

      • colorify

        public static void colorify​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                            int colorR,
                            int colorG,
                            int colorB,
                            int changeR,
                            int changeG,
                            int changeB)
        General colorify method that will turn the RGB pixels of an image into a certain colour Works for any color (R, G, B) and increment/decrement values
        Parameters:
        bi - The BufferedImage (passed by reference) to change
        colorR - The red value of the desired color
        colorG - The green value of the desired color
        colorB - The blue value of the desired color
        changeR - The change in the red value after one iteration of the method
        changeG - The change in the green value after one iteration of the method
        changeB - The change in the blue value after one iteration of the method

        public static greenfoot.GreenfootImage createGreenfootImageFromBI​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        Takes in a BufferedImage and returns a GreenfootImage.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        GreenfootImage A GreenfootImage built from the BufferedImage provided.

      • unpackPixel

        public static int[] unpackPixel​(int rgbaValue)
        Takes in an rgb value - the kind that is returned from BufferedImage's getRGB() method - and returns 4 integers for easy manipulation.
        Parameters:
        rgbaValue - The value of a single pixel as an integer, representing
        8 bits for red, green and blue and 8 bits for alpha:
        alpha   red     green   blue
        00000000000000000000000000000000
        Returns:
        int[4] Array containing 4 shorter ints
        0       1       2       3
        alpha   red     green   blue

      • packagePixel

        public static int packagePixel​(int r,
                               int g,
                               int b,
                               int a)
        Takes in a red, green, blue and alpha integer and uses bit-shifting to package all of the data into a single integer.
        Parameters:
        int - red value (0-255)
        int - green value (0-255)
        int - blue value (0-255)
        int - alpha value (0-255)
        Returns:
        int Integer representing 32 bit integer pixel ready for BufferedImage
